solution_line_template: There are {coins_first_hour} coins during the first hour. {coins_second_hour} coins are added during the second and third hours and {coins_fourth_hour} coins are added during the fourth hour. By the fourth hour there are {coins_first_hour}+{coins_second_hour}+{coins_third_hour}+{coins_fourth_hour} =<<{coins_first_hour}+{coins_second_hour}+{coins_third_hour}+{coins_fourth_hour}={coins_by_fourth_hour}>>{coins_by_fourth_hour} coins

The number of coins after giving {coins_taken_out} to her mother is {coins_by_fourth_hour}-{coins_taken_out}=<<{coins_by_fourth_hour}-{coins_taken_out}={coins_after_fifth_hour}>>{coins_after_fifth_hour}
